thread.title: Gary Neville has 'overstepped mark' with attack on Gunners fans, says Arsenal Fan TV's Robbie Lyle
thread.title_full: Gary Neville has 'overstepped mark' with attack on Gunners fans, says Arsenal Fan TV's Robbie Lyle

author: James Benge
title: Gary Neville has 'overstepped mark' with attack on Gunners fans, says Arsenal Fan TV's Robbie Lyle
text:
Tuesday 7 February 2017 11:43 GMT Click to followES Sport Gone too far: Robbie Lyle has hit back at pundit Gary Neville Getty Images 
Gary Neville has gone too far with his attack on Arsenal fans who want Arsene Wenger out, says the founder of the channel criticised by the former England defender. 
Neville has accepted an invitation to appear on Arsenal Fan TV after he angered some supporters with his comments on Sky Sports. 
During Arsenal’s 3-1 defeat at Chelsea on Saturday, the co‑commentator called a Gunners fan “an idiot” for holding up a banner reading ‘Enough is enough, time to go’. 
On Sunday, following Manchester United’s win over Leicester he returned to the subject, saying: “I walked out of Chelsea’s ground yesterday and there were a couple of these Arsenal Fan TV cameras and it was embarrassing listening to it. I was watching Arsenal fans slating him [Wenger] and I thought he doesn’t deserve that. He’s done an unbelievable job.” 'Arsene Wenger remains but Arsenal's title DNA has been totally lost' 
Robbie Lyle, the founder and face of Arsenal Fan TV, will tackle Neville (right) on the issue when they meet on the YouTube channel. 
However, Lyle said today: “I’m not saying people can’t be critical of us, you have to accept their criticism, but I just feel that when it comes to criticising fans and saying they’re ‘embarrassing’ that’s overstepping the mark. You may not agree with what they’re saying but to call them ‘idiots’ and things like that, I don’t think is right. In Pictures | Chelsea vs Arsenal | 04/02/2017 In Pictures | Chelsea vs Arsenal | 04/02/2017 1/44
